Params: {3: 'As Veronica falls in defeat, she staggers backward, losing her balance.'}
{3: "Instead of Aleksei's supporting arms behind her, what awaits her is..."}
{3: 'Hanying springs up, using her hairpin to push Aleksei back in one fluid motion.'}
{3: 'But she is too late. In an instant, "Aleksei" plunges his dagger deep into Veronica\'s frame.'}
{3: '"Aleksei\'s" once-composed face twists into a grimace as he calmly grips the dagger.'}
{2: 'Aleksei', 3: "I once looked forward to being amazed by you, but now I see you're just too weak...", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Aleksei', 3: "But it's fine... heh heh... I'll take your place, lead the mechanoids, and create a world where only mechanoids exist.", 4: '1'}
{3: 'In his mind, he is already envisioning a grand, majestic world of mechanoids—a blueprint now lying within his reach.'}
{3: 'Veronica struggles to prop herself up, staring in disbelief at the figure before her—someone who looks familiar yet feels like a complete stranger.'}
{2: 'Aleksei', 3: "Hah, of course I'm not. That fragile coward thinks he can enter the sanctum of mechanoids with his mere human flesh... Such hubris demands a price, wouldn't you agree?", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Aleksei', 3: 'Every living being pays the price for their choices—you and I both.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Aleksei', 3: "Didn't you say it yourself? That everything could be sacrificed for our mechanoid kin... ugh...", 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Aleksei', 3: "No... I won't let you harm... Veronica...", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Aleksei', 3: "You won't survive without me! This pathetic wreck of a body you have can't possibly sustain...", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Aleksei', 3: "Even so, I won't let you hurt Veronica!", 4: '1'}
{3: "Aleksei yanks the dagger out of Veronica's frame, struggling with all his might against the other presence within his body."}
{1: '1', 2: 'Aleksei', 3: 'You may... you may control my vocal and visual module, but...', 4: '1', 5: '2'}
{1: '1', 3: 'His fingers tense up as dull sparks burst from his mechanical arm.', 4: '1', 5: '2'}
{1: '1', 3: "After several moments of internal struggle, Aleksei's own mind finally prevails. He seizes the dagger and, with all his might, plunges it deep into his chest.", 4: '1'}
{3: 'Lying on the ground, Veronica struggles to prop herself up.'}
{3: 'With his battered mechanical body, Aleksei crawls slowly toward Veronica.'}
{2: 'Aleksei', 3: "I'm sorry... I can't control my body anymore.", 4: '2'}
{2: 'Aleksei', 3: 'The one who calls himself "the Emperor"... His mind is like a digital ghost, controlling every mechanical part of me...', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Aleksei', 3: "But he can't control my mind... My mind has always been human.", 4: '2'}
{3: 'He coughs and lets out a slow, bitter laugh.'}
{2: 'Aleksei', 3: "You used to mock me, didn't you? About how I could never fully become a mechanoid, no matter what...", 4: '2'}
{3: 'Veronica has never realized how her harsh words have become blades, deeply wounding her friend.'}
{2: 'Aleksei', 3: "I know. I know you've always been like this...", 4: '2'}
{3: 'Aleksei speaks slowly, his gaze fixed on Veronica as if trying to engrave every detail of her appearance into his visual module.'}
{2: 'Aleksei', 3: "I'm sorry, Veronica. Please, stop Bifrost and end this war. It's all my fault. I was too arrogant, thinking I could have it all under control...", 4: '2'}
{2: 'Veronica', 3: "Those aren't the words you spoke to me.", 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Aleksei', 3: 'If we successfully drag humanity into the abyss, these tragedies will never happen again.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Aleksei', 3: "This is the bridge's final charge, Veronica. Babylonia is within our grasp now.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Aleksei', 3: '...There will be no more lies in that world.', 4: '1'}

{2: 'Aleksei', 3: "Veronica, I've witnessed the rise and fall of the mechanoids in Aerospace City as a machinist. Today, you may finally lead them toward a future that truly belongs to your kind...", 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Aleksei', 3: '...I didn\'t know his origins, but the ghost who called himself "the Emperor" told me he could help me become a real mechanoid, so...', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Aleksei', 3: "I'm sorry, Veronica. I can't deny it... All this calamity might have been caused by my own selfish desires.", 4: '2'}
{3: 'He gazes at the woman before him, giving her his final smile.'}
{3: "The damaged mechanical parts emit quiet beeps as Aleksei's expression freezes in place, his unfinished words cut short."}
{3: 'The female mechanoid silently struggles to her feet, using her spear to support herself.'}
{3: 'She tosses a memory unit to Hanying.'}
{2: 'Veronica', 3: "Connect the key to Bifrost's central control system, and it will cease its activation sequence.", 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Veronica', 3: "That's not where my core is. My core... is somewhere else.", 4: '1'}
{3: "As the dagger pierces her shell, she notices something strange—the blade, originally aiming at her frame's core, was twisted in an unusual direction."}
{3: 'Perhaps... Aleksei had already begun fighting "the Emperor" for control over his body since then.'}
{2: 'Veronica', 3: '...Go. Shut down Bifrost before I change my mind.', 4: '1'}
{3: "She stands before Aleksei's broken body, silent as a gravestone."}
{3: 'As Veronica ceases her orders, the mechanoids gradually stop fighting. Seizing this opportunity, Yulia rushes toward Bifrost where Dimitri awaits.'}
{1: '1', 3: "The blizzard rages on. Dimitri's broken frame lies exposed in the swirling snow, so frail that the wind could seemingly lift him into the sky at any moment."}
{3: 'Despite his memory shell being damaged from the connection process, Dimitri stubbornly continues to repeat his previous actions.'}
{2: 'SDC-39', 3: 'The Earth... Would it look like this from space? A tiny, blue star...', 4: '1'}
{2: 'SDC-39', 3: "Once Bifrost is built, we'll be able to go see it for ourselves...", 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Yulia', 3: "Quick, hide, Dimitri... Don't let Dad find out I snuck you out.", 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Yulia', 3: "This goes against Dad and the others' new rules. They said all abnormal mechanoids must be eliminated, and that you're one of them...", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Yulia', 3: "But why would Dima be an abnormal mechanoid? I've never thought Dima was abnormal. Dima is my friend and always greets me whenever we meet...", 4: '1'}
{3: 'On Bifrost, the young girl propped herself up in her wheelchair, playfully imitating mechanoid movements.'}
{2: 'Yulia', 3: "Hmm... I don't understand why things have suddenly changed like this. So many mechanoids are gone now—39 who worked on Bifrost, Bal who guarded the city gate, and...", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Yulia', 3: "Why did things turn out like this? We all live in Aerospace City together, so why can't we be... family?", 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Yulia', 3: "Yeah... If only there weren't so many strange things happening here. We could've all lived together like we used to...", 4: '1'}
{3: "Dimitri is indeed familiar with the reactor's structure, just as he mentioned, having practiced the shutdown procedure numerous times before."}
{3: 'Even with his memory shell circuits nearly completely destroyed, he continues to perform the action etched deep within his memories.'}
{3: 'The girl tumbles from her wheelchair and, with every ounce of her strength left, staggers into the howling blizzard.'}
{2: 'Yulia', 3: 'Bifrost... has been stopped. You did it, Dima, you did it.'}
{3: "Tears stream down Yulia's face, crystallizing into ice."}
{2: 'Dimitri', 3: 'Without so many, strange things happening here, we, can all live together like we used to.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Yulia', 3: "That's wonderful... Dima, you did it. You did it..."}
{3: "Dimitri's memory shell begins to collapse from forcefully connecting to the reactor, his visual modules growing increasingly blurry."}
{2: 'Dimitri', 3: 'Yula, do mechanoids... have souls too? Where do our souls... go?', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Dimitri', 3: 'Will I be able to see... 39 there?', 4: '1'}
{3: "She holds Dimitri's body tightly, curling up in the howling snow."}
{3: 'The mechanoid gives no response, but his body stays warm for a long while before slowly turning cold.'}
